content.content:
{"baseRefName":"main","body":"## Summary

- Implements the C++ code generator for the rivus bootstrap compiler (#56)
- Follows the same architectural pattern as TypeScript and Zig codegens
- Includes norma-registry integration for stdlib method translations
- Targets C++23 features (std::format, ranges, concepts)

## Implementation Details

### Directory Structure
```
fons/rivus/codegen/cpp/
â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab          # Entry point (generateCpp)
â”œâ”€â”€ nucleus.fab        # CppGenerator context
â”œâ”€â”€ typus.fab          # Type translation
â”œâ”€â”€ expressia/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab      # Expression dispatch (with norma integration)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ littera.fab    # Literals
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ obiectum.fab   # Object/struct literals
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ scriptum.fab   # Format strings
â””â”€â”€ sententia/
    â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab      # Statement dispatch
    â”œâ”€â”€ varia.fab      # Variable declarations
    â”œâ”€â”€ functio.fab    # Function declarations
    â”œâ”€â”€ si.fab         # if/else
    â”œâ”€â”€ dum.fab        # while
    â”œâ”€â”€ iteratio.fab   # for loops
    â”œâ”€â”€ redde.fab      # return
    â”œâ”€â”€ scribe.fab     # print (std::cout)
    â”œâ”€â”€ genus.fab      # struct/class
    â”œâ”€â”€ ordo.fab       # enum
    â””â”€â”€ incipit.fab    # main()
```

### Type Mappings
| Faber | C++ |
|-------|-----|
| `numerus` | `int64_t` |
| `fractus` | `double` |
| `textus` | `std::string` |
| `bivalens` | `bool` |
| `lista<T>` | `std::vector<T>` |
| `tabula<K,V>` | `std::unordered_map<K,V>` |
| `copia<T>` | `std::unordered_set<T>` |

### Features
- Norma integration: Translates stdlib methods via norma-registry
- Include tracking: Minimal headers based on actual usage
- Format strings: `scriptum()` â†’ `std::format()`
- Range-based for loops: `ex items pro item` â†’ `for (auto& item : items)`
- Optional support: Nullable types â†’ `std::optional<T>`

## Test plan

- [x] All syntax checks pass on all 18 new files
- [ ] Integration test: Compile sample Faber code to C++ (requires CLI integration)
- [ ] Verify generated C++ compiles with g++/clang++

Closes #56

content.content:
Fixed build errors in C++ codegen:

1. **typus.fab**: Changed `reddit` to `redde` inside multi-line case blocks. The `reddit` keyword is only for single-line returns without braces.

2. **sententia/si.fab**: Rewrote the else-if chain handling to use a while loop pattern (matching the TypeScript codegen approach) instead of recursively calling `genSi` and trying to trim the indentation. The original code called `.longitudo()` on `g.ind()` which the compiler couldn't resolve without type info.

All 125 rivus files now compile successfully. Tests pass.

{"body":"## Summary

Create the C++ code generator for rivus, with norma-registry integration from the start.

## Current State

| Component | Status |
|-----------|--------|
| `fons/norma/*.fab` | âœ… C++ translations defined (`@ verte cpp`) |
| `fons/rivus/codegen/norma-registry.gen.fab` | âœ… Generated with C++ cases (~150 entries) |
| `fons/subsidia/cpp/` | âœ… Runtime library (`collectiones.hpp`) |
| `fons/rivus/codegen/cpp/` | âŒ **Does not exist** |

### What exists in norma/*.fab

```fab
# lista.fab
@ verte cpp "push_back"
functio adde(T elem) -> vacuum

@ verte cpp (ego) -> "Â§.size()"
functio longitudo() -> numerus

# textus.fab
@ verte cpp (ego) -> "Â§.length()"
functio longitudo() -> numerus
```

### What exists in subsidia/cpp/

Helper functions in `collectiones.hpp`:
- `lista_addita`, `lista_praeposita`, `lista_ordinata`, `lista_inversa`
- `tabula_conflata`, `tabula_inversa`, `tabula_selecta`
- `copia_unio`, `copia_intersectio`, `copia_differentia`
- Plus many more complex operations

## Goal

Create C++ codegen so that:

```fab
fixum l = [] innatum lista<numerus>
l.adde(42)
scribe l.longitudo()
```

Generates valid C++23:

```cpp
#include <vector>
#include <iostream>

int main() {
    std::vector<int64_t> l;
    l.push_back(42);
    std::cout << l.size() << std::endl;
    return 0;
}
```

## Tasks

### Phase 1: Scaffold codegen structure

Create directory structure mirroring TypeScript/Zig:

```
fons/rivus/codegen/cpp/
â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab          # Entry point (generateCpp)
â”œâ”€â”€ nucleus.fab        # CppGenerator context
â”œâ”€â”€ typus.fab          # Type translation
â”œâ”€â”€ expressia/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab      # Expression dispatch (with norma integration)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ littera.fab    # Literals
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ obiectum.fab   # Object/struct literals
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ scriptum.fab   # Format strings
â””â”€â”€ sententia/
    â”œâ”€â”€ index.fab      # Statement dispatch
    â”œâ”€â”€ varia.fab      # Variable declarations
    â”œâ”€â”€ functio.fab    # Function declarations
    â”œâ”€â”€ si.fab         # if/else
    â”œâ”€â”€ dum.fab        # while
    â”œâ”€â”€ iteratio.fab   # for loops
    â”œâ”€â”€ redde.fab      # return
    â”œâ”€â”€ scribe.fab     # print (std::cout)
    â”œâ”€â”€ genus.fab      # struct/class
    â””â”€â”€ ordo.fab       # enum
```

### Phase 2: Core implementation

1. **nucleus.fab** - Generator context with indentation, includes tracking
2. **typus.fab** - Type mapping:
   - `numerus` â†’ `int64_t`
   - `fractus` â†’ `double`
   - `textus` â†’ `std::string`
   - `bivalens` â†’ `bool`
   - `lista<T>` â†’ `std::vector<T>`
   - `tabula<K,V>` â†’ `std::unordered_map<K,V>`
   - `copia<T>` â†’ `std::unordered_set<T>`
3. **expressia/index.fab** - With norma integration from start
4. **sententia/index.fab** - Statement dispatch

### Phase 3: Norma integration

Wire up `getNormaTranslation("cpp", ...)` in expression codegen - same pattern as TypeScript.

## Reference Files

- `fons/rivus/codegen/ts/` - Full TypeScript implementation
- `fons/rivus/codegen/zig/` - Partial Zig implementation
- `fons/subsidia/cpp/collectiones.hpp` - Runtime helpers

## Notes

- Target C++23 (ranges, concepts available)
- Use `#include` for stdlib headers (vector, string, unordered_map, etc.)
- Include `collectiones.hpp` for complex operations
- Consider `std::optional<T>` for nullable types","labels":[{"id":"LA_kwDOQtN8T88AAAACUaKMuw","name":"worker:03","description":"","color":"0E8A16"}],"state":"OPEN","title":"Create C++ codegen with norma integration"}

    â”œâ”€â”€ redde.fab      # return
    â”œâ”€â”€ scribe.fab     # print (std::cout)
    â”œâ”€â”€ genus.fab      # struct/class
    â””â”€â”€ ordo.fab       # enum
```

### Phase 2: Core implementation

1. **nucleus.fab** - Generator context with indentation, includes tracking
2. **typus.fab** - Type mapping:
   - `numerus` â†’ `int64_t`
   - `fractus` â†’ `double`
   - `textus` â†’ `std::string`
   - `bivalens` â†’ `bool`
   - `lista<T>` â†’ `std::vector<T>`
   - `tabula<K,V>` â†’ `std::unordered_map<K,V>`
   - `copia<T>` â†’ `std::unordered_set<T>`
3. **expressia/index.fab** - With norma integration from start
4. **sententia/index.fab** - Statement dispatch

### Phase 3: Norma integration

Wire up `getNormaTranslation("cpp", ...)` in expression codegen - same pattern as TypeScript.

## Reference Files

- `fons/rivus/codegen/ts/` - Full TypeScript implementation
- `fons/rivus/codegen/zig/` - Partial Zig implementation
- `fons/subsidia/cpp/collectiones.hpp` - Runtime helpers

## Notes

- Target C++23 (ranges, concepts available)
- Use `#include` for stdlib headers (vector, string, unordered_map, etc.)
- Include `collectiones.hpp` for complex operations
- Consider `std::optional<T>` for nullable types","labels":[{"id":"LA_kwDOQtN8T88AAAACUaKMuw","name":"worker:03","description":"","color":"0E8A16"}],"state":"OPEN","title":"Create C++ codegen with norma integration"}

# C++ Code Generator - Public API
#
# Entry point for generating C++ from Faber AST.
#
# TRANSFORMS:
#   lista<Sententia> -> C++ source code string

ex "../../ast/sententia" importa Sententia
ex "./nucleus" importa CppGenerator, creaCppGenerator
ex "./sententia/index" importa genSententia

# =============================================================================
# PUBLIC API
# =============================================================================

# Generate C++ source code from a list of statements
@ publica
functio generateCpp(lista<Sententia> corpus) -> textus {
    fixum g = creaCppGenerator()

    # Always include faber collectiones for helper functions
    g.addeInclude("cstdint")

    # Generate body from statements
    varia lines = [] innatum lista<textus>
    ex corpus pro stmt {
        lines.adde(genSententia(stmt, g))
    }

    fixum body = lines.coniunge("\n")

    # Generate preamble with includes
    fixum includes = g.genIncludes()

    # Add faber namespace include for helper functions
    varia preamble = includes
    si g.requisita.lista aut g.requisita.tabula aut g.requisita.copia {
        preamble = preamble + "\n#include \"faber/collectiones.hpp\""
    }

    si preamble != "" {
        preamble = preamble + "\n\n"
    }

    redde scriptum("Â§Â§", preamble, body)
}

# C++ Code Generator - Core generator state
#
# This module provides the CppGenerator genus that holds shared state
# for C++ code generation. Individual gen* functions will be in
# separate files under sententia/ and expressia/.

ex "../typi" importa RequiredFeatures, creaRequiredFeatures

# =============================================================================
# C++ GENERATOR
# =============================================================================

# Core generator state for C++ output.
#
# WHY: Holds indentation state, include tracking, feature tracking,
#      and context flags shared across all statement/expression generators.
@ publicum
genus CppGenerator {
    # Indentation depth (number of levels)
    numerus profunditas

    # Indentation unit (4 spaces for C++ convention)
    textus indentum

    # Set of includes needed
    # WHY: C++ requires explicit includes. Track which headers are used
    #      so the preamble can emit the correct #include directives.
    lista<textus> includes

    # Features used that need preamble setup
    RequiredFeatures requisita

    # Track variable names declared as tabula<K,V> for Map method generation
    lista<textus> tabulaNominata

    # Whether we're inside a function body that returns a value
    bivalens inFunctio

    # Whether we're inside a main() function
    bivalens inMain

    # ==========================================================================
    # INDENTATION
    # ==========================================================================

    # Generate indentation string for current depth
    @ publica
    functio ind() -> textus {
        varia result = ""
        varia i = 0
        dum i < ego.profunditas {
            result = result + ego.indentum
            i += 1
        }
        redde result
    }

    # Increment depth
    @ publica
    functio intraProfundum() {
        ego.profunditas += 1
    }

    # Decrement depth
    @ publica
    functio exiProfundum() {
        ego.profunditas -= 1
    }

    # ==========================================================================
    # INCLUDE MANAGEMENT
    # ==========================================================================

    # Add an include if not already present.
    # WHY: Prevents duplicate includes in generated code.
    @ publica
    functio addeInclude(textus header) {
        ex ego.includes pro existing {
            si existing == header {
                redde
            }
        }
        ego.includes.adde(header)
    }

    # Generate include directives for all tracked headers.
    @ publica
    functio genIncludes() -> textus {
        si ego.includes.longitudo() == 0 {
            redde ""
        }
        varia lines = [] innatum lista<textus>
        ex ego.includes pro header {
            lines.adde(scriptum("#include <Â§>", header))
        }
        redde lines.coniunge("\n")
    }

    # ==========================================================================
    # TABULA TRACKING
    # ==========================================================================

    # Register a variable name as tabula type
    @ publica
    functio registraTabula(textus nomen) {
        ego.tabulaNominata.adde(nomen)
    }

    # ==========================================================================
    # COMMENT HANDLING (stubbed for bootstrap)
    # ==========================================================================

    @ publica
    functio notaePrae(ignotum stmt) -> textus {
        redde ""
    }

    @ publica
    functio notaePost(ignotum stmt) -> textus {
        redde ""
    }
}

# =============================================================================
# FACTORY
# =============================================================================

# Create a new CppGenerator with default settings
@ publica
functio creaCppGenerator() -> CppGenerator {
    redde {
        profunditas: 0,
        indentum: "    ",
        includes: [] innatum lista<textus>,
        requisita: creaRequiredFeatures(),
        tabulaNominata: [] innatum lista<textus>,
        inFunctio: falsum,
        inMain: falsum
    } qua CppGenerator
}
